property.name: Text
property.value: Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for The Dunland Trap scenario. Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the encounter deck: 4x Boar Clan Warrior 4x Hithaeglir Stream 1x Dunlending Ambush 1x Frenzied Attack 1x Low on Provisions Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard The Dunland Trap encounter deck. Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active through the game, which is now ready to begin.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After Boar Clan Ambusher attacks and destroys a character, discard a random card from your hand.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: If this attack destroys a character, discard a random card from your hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, he deals 1 damage to a hero he controls.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Deal 1 damage to a hero you control (2 damage instead if undefended).

property.name: Text
property.value: While Plains of Dunland is in the staging area, each Dunland enemy gets -20 engagement cost and cannot be optionally engaged. Travel: The first player engages the highest Û enemy in the staging area to travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Munuv Dûv River is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, he deals 1 shadow card to an enemy engaged with him."

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Raise your threat by 1 for each enemy engaged with you.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Hithaeglir Woods is in the staging area, each Dunland enemy in the staging area cannot take damage. Travel: Deal each Dunland enemy a shadow card to travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each engaged enemy makes an immediate attack. If no attacks are made this way, Boar Clan Assault gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Each enemy engaged with you gets +1 Û until the end of the phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player draws 1 card. Until the end of the round, add X $ to the total $ in the staging area. X is the number of cards in the first player's hand.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Put the topmost enemy in the discard pile into play engaged with you and deal it a shadow card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for The Three Trials scenario. Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the encounter deck: 3x Spirit of the Wild 3x Grim Foothills 1x Tangled Woods 3x Turned Around Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard The Three Trials encounter deck. Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active through the game, which is now ready to begin.

property.name: Text
property.value: You are playing Nightmare mode. Each engaged Guardian enemy contributes its $ to the total $ in the staging area. While the Trial of Intuition is the current trial, each Guardian enemy cannot be damaged, and each Barrow location cannot be the active location and is immune to player card effects.

property.name: Text
property.value: If Wolf's Guardian is in play or in the victory display, each Wolf enemy gets +1 Û. Forced" At the beginning of the encounter phase, Wolf Spirit engages the player who controls Key of the Wolf or is engaged with Wolf's Gaurdian, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: If Boar's Guardian is in play or in the victory display, each Boar enemy gets +1 Ù. Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Boar Spirit engages the player who controls Key of the Boar or is engaged with Boar's Guardian, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: If Raven's Guardian is in play or in the victory display, each Raven enemy gets +1 $. Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, Raven Spirit engages the player who controls Key of the Raven or is engaged with Raven's Guardian, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Sacred Forest is in the staging area, each Guardian enemy gains: "Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from this enemy, heal 2 damage on it for each time counter removed." Travel: Remove each time counter from an enemy in play to travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: When faced with the option to travek, players must travel to Haunted Pillars, if able. When Revealed: Either return the active location to the staging area, or Haunted Pillars gains surge.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to a hero with a Key objective attached, if able. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero cannot commit to the quest, and cannot attack or defend against enemies with a Trait shared by any of that hero's attached Key objectives.")

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: Each non-unique character gets -1 Ò and cannot attack enemies that share a Trait with the current trial's key objective.")

property.name: Text
property.value: Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for the Trouble in Tharbad scenario. Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the encounter deck: 1x Orc Hunter 2x Orc Skirmisher 2x Tharbad Hideout 2x Hidden Alleyway 1x Decrepit Rooftops 2x Orc Hunting Party Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard Trouble in Tharbad encounter deck. Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active through the game, which is now ready to begin. Playing Tip: There are many effects in the nightmare version of Trouble in Tharbad that reduce the players' threat elimination level. It may be helpful to use a separate threat tracker or pen and paper to track the players' current threat elimination level.

property.name: Text
property.value: You are playing Nightmare Mode. Setup: Raise each player's starting threat by 5. Progress cannot be placed on The Crossing at Tharbad while Bellach is in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: While a player controls 5 or more allies, Bellach's Hunter gets –20 engagement cost. Forced: When Bellach's Hunter engages a player, that player must either remove all time counters from the current quest or deal 5 damage to a hero he controls.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Either reduce each player's threat elimination level by 2, or Orc Seeker engages the first player and makes an immediate attack.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Reduce each player's threat elimination level by 2 (5 instead if undefended).

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: When Blood Hound engages you, raise your threat by 5.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Either raise your threat by 10, or attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: While City of Spies is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: When you commit a character to the quest, raise your threat by 1. This effect does not stack with other copies of City of Spies."

property.name: Text
property.value: While Dark Pathway is the active location, the first treachery card without the printed surge keyword revealed during the quest phase gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Either remove 1 time counter from the current quest or treat this attack as undefended.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either remove 1 time counter from the quest or discard an ally he controls from play. Then, if any player's threat is 20 or less, Waylaid by Agents gained doomed 3.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if your threat is 20 or less).

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach Tharbad Patrol to a non-unique location in the staging area without a copy of Tharbad Patrol attached. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After the players travel to attached location, each player must discard the top 2 cards from the encounter deck and engage each enemy he discarded in this way.")

property.name: Text
property.value: Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for The Nîn-in-Eilph scenario. Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the encounter deck: 1x A Weary Passage (Stage 1B) 1x Impassable Marshland (Stage 2B) 3x Neekerbreekers 1x Hidden Eyot 3x Finger of Glanduin 2x Off Track 1x Low on Provisions Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard The Nîn-in-Eilph encounter deck. Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active through the game, which is now ready to begin.

property.name: Text
property.value: You are playing Nightmare mode. Forced: When the players advance to stage 2A, add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player).

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After Deadly Marsh Adder engages you, discard a damaged character you control. Forced: After the players advance to a quest stage, return Deadly Marsh Adder to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cannot have attachments. While Swarms of Mosquitoes is in the victory display, it gains: "Forced: After the players advance to a quest stage, return Swarms of Mosquitoes to the staging area."

property.name: Text
property.value: While Desolate Meadow is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After any number of time counters are removed from the current quest, heal 2 damage on each Creature enemy in play."

property.name: Shadow
property.value: If this attack destroys a character, remove all progress from the current quest.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Peat Bog is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: After the players advance to a quest stage, each player discards 1 random card from his hand."

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from the current quest or remove each character with 3 or more Ò from the quest.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Return the topmost location in the encounter discard pile to the staging area. Until the end of the phase, each location in the staging area gets +1 $.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1.

property.name: Text
property.value: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 2A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck. Allies enter play exhausted. Forced: When the players defeat this stage, advance to a random stage 3A.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 1. Add Ancient Marsh-dweller to the staging area (from out of play or engaged with a player) and heal all damage from it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, advance to a different stage 3A at random. Return this stage to the quest deck. Treachery card effects cannot be canceled.

property.name: Text
property.value: Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for the Celebrimbor's Secret scenario. Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the encounter deck: 1x Orc Skirmisher 1x Orc Hunter 3x Prowling Wolf 1x Ruined Plaza 1x City Remains 1x Ancient Foundation 3x Broken Lands 1x Spies from Mordor 2x Orc Hunting Party Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard Celebrimbor's Secret encounter deck. Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active through the game, which is now ready to begin.

property.name: Text
property.value: You are playing Nightmare more. Forced: When any amount of progress would be placed on a location in the staging area, reduce that amount to 1. Scour Deal 1 damage to a location in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Bellach cannot take damage. Scour: Heal all damage from Bellach's Bodyguard.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Attacking enemy cannot take damage until the end of the phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Trigger Little Snuffler's Scour effect. Scour: The first player discards a random card from his hand and assigns X damage among locations in the staging area. X is the discarded card's cost.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After any amount of damage is placed on Bones of Hollin, raise each player's threat by that amount. Travel: Place 2 damage on an Ost-in-Edhil location in play to travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: Dusty Labyrinth gets +1 $ for each damage on it. Scour: Deal 2 damage to Dusty Labyrinth. Travel: The first player must place a card from his hand facedown underneath The Orcs' Search to travel here.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each location in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, each damaged location gets +1 $. If there are no locations in the staging area, Hateful Search gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Defending player discards a non-objective attachment he controls.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Bellach makes an immediate attack against each player in turn order. Then, deal 1 damage to the active location for each character destroyed by this effect.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Place Closing In facedown underneath The Orcs' Search.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each card underneath The Orcs' Search.

property.name: Text
property.value: Begin with the standard quest deck and encounter deck for The Antlered Crown scenario. Remove the following cards, in the specified quantities, from the encounter deck: 1x Dunland Prowler 1x Dunland Berserker 2x Dunlending Bandit 3x Raven Skirmisher 3x Raven War-camp 2x Driven Back Then, shuffle the encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck into the remainder of the standard The Antlered Crown encounter deck. Finally, flip this setup card over and place it next to the quest deck. Its effect remains active through the game, which is now ready to begin. Note: Dunlending Horde has the "Dunlending Warriors" encounter set icon and should be shuffled into the Raven deck during setup.

property.name: Text
property.value: You are playing Nightmare mode. Locations with time counters on them cannot be discarded from play by player card effect.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cannot have attachments or take non-combat damage. Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, heal all damage from Dunlending Horde.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from a location in play, or Raven Clan Elite makes an immediate attack against the first player.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, remove 1 time counter from a location in play.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Attacking enemy gets +X Û, where X is the Time X value on the active location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, each player reveals the top card of the Raven deck and adds it to the staging area. Forced: When this location is explored, add the top card of the Raven deck to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this location, return each enemy in play to the staging area.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Either remove 1 time counter from a location in play, or return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player draws 1 card. Until the end of the round, add 1 to the total $ in the staging area for each card in the first player's hand.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. If this attack destroys a character, discard your hand and draw three cards.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Add the top 2 cards of the Raven Deck to the staging area. If any player has 5 or more cards in hand, this effect cannot be canceled.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Put the top card of the Raven deck into play, engaged with you.
